definition: to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

sentences.english: Many English words come from abroad.
sentences.chinese: 許多英語詞彙是外來語。

sentences.english: Katakana is mainly used by Japanese for words of foreign origin.
sentences.chinese: 在日語之中，片假名是用來書寫外來語的。

sentences.english: Loanwords in Chinese and Japanese have common characteristics as well as different characteristics.
sentences.chinese: 日漢外來語既有相同點又有不同點。

sentences.english: The introduction of loan words follow certain principles and rules.
sentences.chinese: 外來語的進入遵循一定的原則和規律。

sentences.english: Samples from the dead whale (pdf) will ultimately tell what killed this denizen of the deep.
sentences.chinese: 從死鯨的例子將預知最終死亡深層的外來語。

sentences.english: The loanwords written in your article were overdone.
sentences.chinese: 你文章中使用的外來語太多了。

definition: to make far-fetched claims (idiom)/to offer outlandish explanations
radical of a compound word (in European language)
to make a sound effect/sound effect/(historical linguistics) to reconstruct the sound system of an archaic language
